posts.content:
Saw this on Friday Ad today and also VolksWorld, 22nd July.

http://motors.friday-ad.co.uk/birmingha ... Enhanced=1

http://www.volksworld.com/classifieds/c ... gen-advert

My reasoning is that just look at the price for one and secondly this very bus has been on eBay in the past week or so for Â£23k (see below).

http://www.ebay.co.uk/itm/Split-Screen- ... true&rt=nc

Ill try and get in touch with the eBay guy as I thinks its almost certainly his looking at the feedback etc.

Beware peeps.
I've just spoken to the guy who owned it before he sold it on eBay and he's going to notify the new owners so thats a result. That's my good deed done for the day!
What I'm amazed at is a magazine that has been around for so long can not spot a scam when it comes in. Surely any ad they print/upload is checked in some way??

OP, nah, they don't care, it's money at the end of the day (I guess you have to pay for the ad?).

We advertised our business in the mag years ago and it was all flowers n friends till we paid for the 6 months ad then they were like, 'Oh you again, what do you want now?'. They are a business after all and they're workers are employees so 9 times out of 10 they don't give a gnats f*rt (parp) as long as it's revenue IMHO. I'd never treat my customers like that.

I replied to this to test the water, calls himself Peter and sometimes Joe when he forgets who he is or which advert he is replying to !
Won't let ya see before purchase, Usual agency delivery only and pay only through Escrow. 'Due to work commitments' he can't ever show you the vehicle before purchase. Now what kind of job prevents you from that anywhere in the world. Even astronauts come down to earth to let a potential buyer see the cars they sell !
Hate to have this guys job.
